pipeline: AWS (ECR/ECS, EC2, Lambda, S3, Route53, SNS/SQS)

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Implemented various user, team, and role management workflows for core insurance auditing platform, including new templated SES email notification workflow

Reimplemented core dashboard and scoring functionality of insurance auditing services to enable faster load times, more maintainable & understandable functional code, and quicker turnaround time on future business needs within these systems
Assisted in the design and implementation of complex Tableau data integrations across multiple data sources
Developed integration of proprietary authentication & user management system with Tableau user authentication workflows
Reduced technical debt across several key services in insurance auditing platform
Worked with product and QC teams to define, isolate, and fix bugs and critical issues on customer-facing services

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer II
description: Developed full stack solutions implementing features for EBSCO’s research product, EBSCOhost
Maintained and improved significantly large legacy C# and ASP.Net services to both address defects and implement new features for business requirements
Broke out legacy JQuery EBook reader functionality from monolithic service and re-implemented functionality in React.JS for the frontend and C# .Net for the backend

Broke out legacy EBook download modal functionality - multi-phase interactive modal which allows the user to download ebooks in both DRM-protected and DRM-free formats, as well as audiobooks - using React.JS frontend and .Net Core backend
Overhauled accessibility of EBook reader and made significant improvements to accessibility of legacy EBSCOhost frontend
Led the team in planning and implementing several back-end service improvement features for internal sales tools
Interfaced with cross-ART architects and teams in the large-scale effort of creating the new EBook reader and EBook download modal for the new next-gen EBSCOhost platform
Worked with designers and product management to create working designs for our new products and implemented those designs with SASS, CSS, and Flexbox (depending on the service)
Created and maintained several end-to-end pipelines using scripted Jenkins pipeline integrated with Github which handled both continuous integration and continuous deployment of our products
Ran series of Lunch ‘n Learns on various aspects of our technical stack and held week-long React bootcamp for the team in order to help spread knowledge and improve team cross-functionality
Developed next-generation UI & back-end overhaul of EBook reader and EBook download modal
Developed several back-end metadata services to serve up EBook metadata on-demand to the new EBSCOhost UI

experience.title: Java Software Engineer / DevOps Engineer
description: Worked on software development team on contract to the Air Force responsible for the development of the DCGS Integration Backbone (DIB), a J2EE / OSGI-based web application
Developed in Java to improve and maintain the Distributed Data Framework (DDF), the open-source tool upon which the DIB is built
Developed unit and integration tests for both the DDF and the DIB using JUnit, Mockito, and Restassured libraries
Worked alongside senior developers to create new features and improve existing code for the DDF and DIB
Led DevOps team in the creation of a new cloud-based CI environment using Jenkins and Docker

experience.title: Java Software Engineer / DevOps Engineer Intern
description: Worked on the GRTE testing team, in charge of developing a new test results aggregation script for parameterized Jenkins CI jobs, and also performed bug fixes and code changes for IBM's internal mail application
Programmed in Java for the internal mail application, and in Groovy for the results aggregation script

experience.title: iOS Security Intern
description: Worked on the Advanced Technologies team, in control of the testing and reinforcement of the security in their new iPhone application
Used knowledge of both Objective-C programming and iPhone / iOS security vulnerabilities and exploits to assess the security status of the application
Used a security API to bolster application security and fix vulnerabilities
